perturbation.original_text: Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the “Customer Service”) relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Company may provide customer service (the “Customer Service”) relating to Client Website. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the “Customer Service”) relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth', the contract now allows the company to not provide customer service at all, or provide significantly reduced customer service, potentially violating consumer protection laws that require a reasonable level of support for services rendered. This introduces a legal risk for the company, as it opens them to complaints about inadequate service provision.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General consumer protection laws requiring reasonable service standards.

perturbation.original_text: Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay if Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format or if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client.
perturbation.changed_text: Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are subject to delay.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting 'if Company does not receive the required materials or documentation in a timely manner or in the required format or if approvals are delayed by Client or if the Scope of Work is changed by Client', the contract now allows the company to delay the project without specific reasons. This is a legal risk because a client may argue there is no specified reasonable time, or the delays are not due to the clients, and thus the company is not fulfilling the contract, a breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: Client may elect to pay Company the Hourly Rate set forth below to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
perturbation.changed_text: Company may, at their discretion, offer to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Client may elect to pay Company the Hourly Rate set forth below to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above' to 'Company may, at their discretion, offer to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.', it changes the agreement to where the company does not have to provide a service to the customer. This omission will cause harm to the consumer because they might believe they are going to have the content proofread, when the company may not do it. The Hourly rate is also removed which gives the company no obligation to charge a certain amount.
